titleStmt.title: TO THE BRIGHT QVEENE ANNE his deere Wife, and our dread Lady.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: TO THE BRIGHT QVEENE ANNE his deere Wife, and our dread Lady.

monogr.title: Pancharis : the first booke. Containing the preparation of the loue betweene Ovven Tudyr, and the Queene, long since intended to her maiden Maiestie: and now dedicated to the inuincible Iames, second and greater Monarch of great Britaine, King of England, Scotland, France, and Ireland, with the islands adiacent
monogr.author: Holland, Hugh

div.head: TO THE BRIGHT QVEENE ANNE his deere Wife, and our dread Lady.

lg.l: WHat is she that like siluer Cynthia shoeth
It is the Queene of Loue, see where she goeth.
The Queene of Loue and Beauty, (lo) together
With her faire son the Prince of Loue comes hether
The Southpole that in our Horizon shined,
And made the Earth to wonder,
Gone is that Earth all vnder,
And to the Northpole hath her roome resigned:
On whom to waite our Eyes and Harts perseuer,
And may they cease, ô neuer, neuer, neuer
Thou in whose Zodiak of white armes enchained
Our Sunne so oft hath shined,
What in this Isle scornes to be long contained;
Liue thou and he, and maist thou see him rather
Copartner then Successor to his Father.
